resources.string: Korea\’s first veterinary medical device\nmedical imaging diagnosis assistance software
Let\'s go find out the health of our pet
To enlarge, tap the picture at the bottom of the screen

SPECIAL CAUTION: The “TTcare” application and other related services, intends to be used for informational purposes only, even if such information may contribute to the general care and well-being of the User\’s pets. It does NOT provide medical advice, opinion, diagnosis, or treatment. It does not replace the advice of qualified healthcare professionals such as User\’s pet\’s veterinarian, nor does it replace the need to have regular checkups or special appointments for User\’s pet\’s health, nor will it work as a medical device. Accordingly, User shall contact qualified healthcare professionals with any questions regarding User\’s pets\’ specific medical condition(s) and seek immediately help from them in case of any emergency situation.
Even if the same pet is photographed, the check result for abnormal signs may vary depending on the environment, quality and angle.

The displayed percentage is the symptom results\nanalyzed by TTcare AI.

If you want to quit scanning the left eye now,\nyou can view the check results for right eye only.
If you want to quit scanning the right eye now,\nyou can only view left eye check results.
If you quit scanning now, you can only view previous results.

You can make one or more selections
for scanning. Use the flash for more accurate results.
Press the shutter button to start automatic scanning for 30 seconds.
While scanning, you can easily add or remove your selections.
Try using <font color=#1495f3>flash, selfie mode</font> for scans and refer to our <font color=#1495f3>user guide.</font>
Use the flash in the dark for more accurate results.

You can make one or more selections
for scanning. Use the flash for more accurate results.
Follow the skin check guide and scan to <font color=#1495f3>check abnormal signs.</font>
While scanning, you can <font color=#1495f3>easily add or remove</font> your selections.
After taking a picture of the part that <font color=#1495f3>appears to be abnormal,</font> such as red spots or abrasions, you can <font color=#1495f3>enlarge or delete</font> the photo.
Try using <font color=#1495f3>flash, selfie mode</font> for scans and refer to our <font color=#1495f3>user guide.</font>
Use the flash in the dark for more accurate results.

You can make single or multiple selections
for scanning. Use the flash for more
accurate results.
Sudden use of flash can startle your pet.\nThere is no scientific evidence that it harms them, but to avoid a glare you can cover the flash with a piece of paper.
For a clear picture, take it from at least 4 inches away and move any hair out of the way.

Please keep your smartphone in landscape mode.\nYour dog need to be walk in one direction for at least three seconds.
Please refer to our user guide for more instructions.
Downloading the necessary files for joint health check
Step 1. Select eye you want to check
You can select one or both eyes. Select to add or remove the eye you want to examine.
Step 2. Tap the shutter button to activate automated scan.
Once the eye detection frame is aligned, the AI will auto-capture the eye.

Check your surroundings(windows, TV etc.) so that there are no objects reflecting in the eye, or try it with the flash on. The flash will cancel out reflections from surrounding objects. Don\’t worry, using flash for a brief moment won\’t affect your pet\’s eye health, but do it slowly as it may startle your pet or they may avoid eye contact. You can cover the flash with a piece of paper to prevent the glare.
If they are having a hard time give it a rest
If scanning is difficult, use selfie mode, but don\'t overdo it if they keep on avoiding or having a hard time. Please take it easy and try again later.
Tip 1. These pictures are difficult to analyze
If something is blocking the eye, if the camera is shaking or if it is hard to focus on the eye, please to re-scan
Once the eye detection frame is aligned, the AI will auto-scan the eyes.
Step 1. Select the skin area to examine
Select all or at least one body part below to start. For other parts(i.e. face, helix, back of the ear), please select ‘Other’.
Step 2. Please take a photo using the shutter button
Make sure nothing gets in the way.

If there is anything on the skin, gently wipe it off before taking a photo. Before taking photos of the body, moisten the fur with water or brush it with your hands to ensure that the skin is visible. The body, paw pads and ears should be photographed with the flash on so that the symptoms can be checked without distorted shadows.
Tip 1. Make sure you focus on the ear opening and the inner ear.
If there’s fur covering the ear opening or helix, gently lift them up with your hands.
Tip 2. Please take a picture between the toes or paw pads.
Take a picture where the symptoms are prominent in the skin between the toes. If there are symptoms on the pads, take a picture so that the skin between the pads is visible.
Tip 3. Make sure that the fur does not cover the skin.
Please take a picture as close as possible so that only the skin is exposed without the background.

If there is any foreign substance on the skin, gently wipe it off before taking a photo. Before taking photos of the body, moisten the fur with water or brush it with your hands to ensure that the skin is visible. The body, paw pads and ears should be photographed with the flash on so that the symptoms can be analyzed without distorted shadows.
Step 1. Select the side of teeth you want to check.
You can select front, right or left. Select to add or remove the side you want to examine.
Step 2. Tap the shutter button to activate automated scan.
Once the teeth detection frame is aligned, the AI will auto-capture the teeth.
Scan in bright settings or use the flash. Sudden use of flash may startle your pet so take it slow.
If they are having a hard time, give it a rest
They may not want to open their mouth or keep moving their head. Take it easy and try it again if it\'s difficult.
Tip 1. These pictures are difficult to analyze
If something is blocking the teeth or if it\'s out of focus, you would need to re-scan.
Once the teeth detection frame is aligned, the AI will auto-scan the teeth.
Step 1. Start filming from each end of your screen
Have your dog start walking from the very left or very right of the screen
step 2. Tap the shutter button to start automatically.

Once AI registers how the dog is walking, the shaded area will change to blue. After 3 seconds, the video will stop on its own. It may take up to 1-2 minutes for the video to be sent and analyzed. Please wait patiently.
If they are having a hard time, take it easy
Don\'t overdo it if they keep avoiding you or having a hard time. Please take a rest and try again later.
Tip 1. Make sure you fix your smartphone and hold still.

If someone is helping you out, just hold the smartphone still while having the dog walk straight from one corner to the other. If you are alone, use a tripod to hold your smartphone straight and still.
Make sure your dog\'s full frame can easily fit into the screen. For small, medium sized dogs, allow for about 4-5 steps in between. For bigger dogs, allow for at least 6-10 steps in between.
Tip 3. These videos are difficult to analyze.
Make sure no one is blocking the dog. If there is more than one dog on the screen, it\'s difficult to analyze. One dog at a time.
Please do not block your dog.
Walk in front of the dog.
